relation: Retrieve a node and read its properties and their values.
This is a jackrabbit specific aggregate privilege of jcr:write and jcr:nodeTypeManagement.
This is an aggregate privilege that contains all other predefined privileges.
Create child nodes of a node.
Perform lifecycle operations on a node.
Lock and unlock a node; refresh a lock.
Modify the access control policies of a node.
Create, modify and remove the properties of a node.
Register, unregister and modify namespace definitions.
Import node type definitions to the repository.

Add and remove mixin node types and change the primary node type of a node. This also includes any calls to Node.addNode and XML importing methods where the mixin or primary type of new node is explicitly specified.
Read the access control policy of a node.
Remove child nodes of a node.
Perform retention management operations on a node.
Perform versioning operations on a node.
The creation and deletion of workspaces through the JCR API.
This is an aggregate privilege that contains: - jcr:modifyProperties - jcr:addChildNodes - jcr:removeNode - jcr:removeChildNodes
pageTitle: User, Group and Access Rights Administration - docs.adobe.com

textBeforeTable: The following privileges are available for selection when adding an access control entry (see the Security API for full details): Privileges It is easier to manage a few groups, rather than many user accounts. To simplify management we recommend that you assign access rights to group accounts, not individual user accounts. Note Principal A principal that is registered in the repository. You can either type in the Principal name or click the icon to the right of the field to open the Select Principal dialog. This allows you to Search for a User or Group. Select the required principal from the resulting list, then click OK to carry the value back to the previous dialog. Repository Selects repository level access control. For example, when setting the jcr:namespaceManagement privilege, which is only relevant for the repository, not a node. Current Path As in the example above, select a resource within the repository. The policies for this "current path" will be shown. The policies
textAfterTable: Registering New Privileges You can also register new privileges: From the toolbar select Tools, then Privileges to display the privileges currently registered. Use the Register Privilege icon (+) to open the dialog and define a new privilege: Click OK to save. The privilege will now be available for selection. Adding an Access Control Entry Select your resource and open the Access Control tab.
